entities.name: pagan festival

entities.name: Truce
entities.description: The truce, or "Ekecheiria," was a sacred armistice that allowed athletes and spectators to travel safely to the Olympic Games.

entities.name: Global Participation

entities.name: Four Years
entities.description: A period of four years, also known as an Olympiad.

entities.name: NAZI GERMANY
entities.description: Nazi Germany refers to the period from 1933 to 1945, characterized by the rule of Adolf Hitler and the Nazi Party, known for its aggressive foreign policies, which led to World War II.

entities.name: athletics
entities.description: Athletics, also known as track and field, includes various events such as running, jumping, throwing, and walking. It is one of the oldest and most popular sports in the world.

entities.name: Doping Scandals
entities.description: Doping scandals involve athletes using performance-enhancing drugs, which is against the rules of the Olympic Games.

entities.name: 393 AD

entities.name: swimming
entities.description: Swimming is one of the traditional events included in the Olympic Games, alongside athletics and other sports. It has been a part of the Games since their inception.

entities.name: peace and understanding among nations
entities.description: Peace and understanding among nations refers to the goal of fostering harmony and mutual respect between different countries through shared cultural activities, such as sports.

entities.name: political disputes
entities.description: Political disputes refer to disagreements or conflicts over political issues, often involving different ideologies, policies, or interests.

attributes.Frequency: Throughout the history of the Olympic Games

entities.name: Sand Court
entities.description: A sand court is a flat, rectangular area covered with fine sand, suitable for playing beach volleyball.

entities.name: Fair Play
entities.description: Fair play is the concept of playing a game or sport according to the rules and in a fair manner.

entities.name: 43 events

entities.name: 1980 Moscow Olympics
entities.description: The 1980 Summer Olympics, officially known as the Games of the XXII Olympiad, were held in Moscow, Soviet Union.

entities.name: Unity
entities.description: Unity refers to a state where people from different backgrounds come together and work towards common goals.

entities.name: snowboarding
entities.description: Snowboarding is a winter sport that involves descending snow-covered slopes while standing on a board attached to the rider"s feet.

entities.name: beach volleyball
entities.description: Beach volleyball is a team sport played by two teams of two players each on a sand court divided by a net.
